intro: Gnaphalium audax, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gnaphalium audax is adapted to harsh alpine environments and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
